|rad2oui = |rad2_ant_conn = U.FL |rad2txchains = 2 |rad2rxchains = 2 |rad2sstreams = 2 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11a/n |rad2n = 300 |rad2a = 54 |rad2freq = 5 |rad2correv = 23 |rad2cap = }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "P/N: 141701620001J REV: 01" is silkscreened on the board. The same hardware is used by the F7D8302 ([http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=85964 mention on DD-WRT forums]). The default SSIDs are '''Belkin.XXXX''' and '''Belkin.XXXX_5GHz''' where '''XXXX''' appears to '''5''' followed by the last three hex digits of the wireless interface MAC address (though this could be incorrect). An example SSID set of SSIDs are '''Belkin.5BB8''' and '''Belkin.5BB8_5GHz''' with MAC 94:44:52:25:4B:B8. ==Links of Interest== [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=70454 On the DD-WRT forums] (internal shots)
[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=78042 Eko's initial support of partial support for the F7D4301 and most major thread for the device] [http://www.myopenrouter.com/forum/thread/31156/Kong-Mod-Update-build-17600/http://www.myopenrouter.com/forum/thread/31156/Kong-Mod-Update-build-17600/ Supports DD-WRT Kong Mod] ([http://www.myopenrouter.com/article/23842/DD-WRT-Kong-Mod-Info/ main Kong Mod thread]) [http://tomatousb.org/forum/t-300489/belkin-f7d4302-play-max-router-support-broadcom-based On the TomatoUSB forum] :This device seems to be working fine with the latest Toastman builds (as of 12/2012). ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing dd-wrt=== Supported by dd-wrt as of = v24 SP2 K2.6 15230 better use [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=78042 CFE mini Web Server] for first flash. Please insert instructions here ===Flashing Tomato=== Please insert instructions here ==USB Info== {{USB dd-wrt}} ==Pictures==
